item.title: Crack the code to startup traction with insights from Chef Robotics, NEA, and ICONIQ at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Finding product-market fit isn’t a milestone — it’s a messy, make-or-break journey. And at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, a founder who’s been through the fire and two investors who’ve helped startups hit escape velocity will break down how to do it right. On the Builders Stage, Rajat Bhageria (Founder & CEO, Chef Robotics), Ann Bordetsky (Partner, […]

item.title: Roku launches Howdy, a $2.99 ad-free streaming service
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The service features a library of nearly 10,000 hours of content from Lionsgate, Warner Bros. Discovery, and FilmRise, alongside select Roku Original titles.

item.title: DeepMind reveals Genie 3, a world model that could be the key to reaching AGI
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Google DeepMind has revealed Genie 3, its latest foundation world model that the AI lab says presents a crucial stepping stone on the path to artificial general intelligence, or human-like intelligence.

item.title: Only 2 days left to save $675 on your TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 ticket
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 marks 20 years of driving the startup world forward — and you’ve got just two days left to join the movement and save up to $675 on your ticket. From October 27–29, Moscone West becomes the home base for over 10,000 movers and makers in the tech world. Join us in San […]

item.title: Spotify expands audiobooks access to family plan members in the US for the first time
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Though Spotify launched its audiobooks service in the U.S. back in 2022, household members on Duo and Family plans have long been left out. Spotify says that will now change.

item.title: SonicWall urges customers to disable SSLVPN amid reports of ransomware attacks
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Security researchers say they have evidence that ransomware gangs are hacking into large companies that rely on fully-patched SonicWall firewalls. The researchers say it's likely the flaw is a "zero-day" bug currently unknown to SonicWall.

item.title: US adds OpenAI, Google, and Anthropic to list of approved AI vendors for federal agencies
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: The companies will see their AI tools offered via a new federal contracting platform, the Multiple Awards Schedule (MAS), which would let government agencies access AI tool sellers with pre-negotiated contracts, rather than negotiating with vendors individually.

item.title: Jury rules Meta violated California privacy laws by quietly collecting Flo users’ menstrual health data
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: The class-action suit was brought by users of period tracking app, Flo, who alleged that the tech giant collected private menstrual health data without users' consent and used it for ad-tracking purposes.

item.title: AI-powered fintech Alaan raises $48M, one of the largest Series A rounds in MENA
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description: When Parthi Duraisamy was a consultant at McKinsey’s Dubai office, he discovered that the American Express cards his company relied on for corporate expenses were rarely accepted in the Middle East. This forced Duraisamy to cover significant travel expenses out of pocket and file endless expense reports. “It was a constant pain,” Duraisamy explained on […]

item.title: Uzbekistan’s first unicorn, Uzum, leaps to a $1.5B valuation
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Uzbekistan's Uzum has raised $65.5 million in a new funding round co-led by China's Tencent and the New York- and London-based VR Capital, with participation from U.S.-based FinSight Capital.

item.title: Jeh Aerospace nets $11M to scale the commercial aircraft supply chain in India
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Indian startup Jeh Aerospace has secured $11 million in a new funding round to help ease global supply chain bottlenecks.

item.title: A top designer was banned from Dribbble. Now he’s building his own competitor.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Dribbble is enforcing its terms of service that lets it take a cut of designers' work, and kicking out those who don't comply. One top designer has had enough, and is building his own startup instead.

item.title: Google says its AI-based bug hunter found 20 security vulnerabilities
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The discoveries by an AI-based bug hunter are significant, as it shows these tools are starting to get real results, even if they still need a human.

item.title: Foxconn sells former GM factory to mystery buyer after failing to make EVs
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: The company has spent more than three years claiming the factory would become an "important" EV hub. But it has barely produced anything there.

item.title: Rivian sues to sell its EVs directly in Ohio
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Today, Rivian can sell EVs directly to consumers in 25 states and Washington D.C.

item.title: Amazon denies report it’s shutting down Wondery podcast studio
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Despite securing big names in the business, the company is now shifting its strategy in an effort to better compete with rivals like Spotify and YouTube.

item.title: TechCrunch Mobility: Tesla’s ride-hailing gambit
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility — your central hub for news and insights on the future of transportation.

item.title: Perplexity accused of scraping websites that explicitly blocked AI scraping
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Internet giant Cloudflare says it detected Perplexity crawling and scraping websites, even after customers had added technical blocks telling Perplexity not to scrape their pages.

item.title: OpenAI says ChatGPT is on track to reach 700M weekly users
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: The app's popularity increased after OpenAI launched an upgraded image-generation feature, powered by the GPT-4 model, in March.

item.title: Elon Musk says he’s bringing back Vine’s archive
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Elon Musk says the company will bring Vine's archive of videos back online.
